Metadata.Title: i18n in Next.js 15
Metadata.Description: Includes examples for zod, SSR, runtime locale switching, and react-email.

ICUDescription.Paragraph1: The ICU (International Components for Unicode) format is a way of handling different linguistic and cultural needs for a given localization.
ICUDescription.Paragraph2: Across different cultures, things like count of objects, numbers (i.e. money), gender, and dates can cause a sentence structure to change in a unique way to that language.
ICUDescription.Paragraph3: Additionally, you may have a dynamic value used in your localization, which would need to be handled differently based on different languages' grammar, etc.

ObjectCountExamples.CartItems: You have {count, plural, =0 {no items} =1 {1 item} other {# items}} in your cart

GenderExamples.ThereAreStudents: {gender, select, male {{count, plural, =1 {There is 1 student (male)} =2 {There are 2 students (male)} other {There are # students (male)}}} female {{count, plural, =1 {There is 1 student (female)} =2 {There are 2 students (female)} other {There are # students (female)}}} other {{count, plural, =1 {There is 1 student} =2 {There are 2 students} other {There are # students}}}}
